reviews.text: All the little extra touches are just great - from the array of books and quirky really different salt and pepper sets, the computer to use upstairs and the plants outside, to the coffee and fridge with beer and water in that you can help yourself to, as there's no bar.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel! It's really different and quirky, and just lovely.

reviews.text: The owner translated the Goethe saying on the wall for us, and was incredibly friendly and helpful, as well as being mych better at English than I am at German!
reviews.title: Feels like home...only cleaner!

reviews.text: My wife made our reservations based on Trip Advisor. So I didn't know what to expect.
reviews.title: It's #1 on TripAdvisor for a reason

reviews.text: The hotel is located downtown (just like everyone else has said), and doesn't have a typical hotel front. It is more of a boutique style hotel. Petra met us at the front desk and checked us in, then showed us our rooms. We got two rooms for the four of us, 19 and 20. One was larger than the other (get 20). The rooms were very clean (a nice change from the last hotel I stayed), and the bathrooms were extraordinarily spotless. I wish I could have taken the shower home with me, because it is nicer than the ones I have at home! They were nice and big for European standards. In the bathrooms were cool little first aid kits mounted on the wall with emergency supplies for the bathroom. Nice touch, I thought. On each bed was a little candy the room had great flat screen televisions and wireless internet. The beds were comfortable, and I slept like a rock both nights we were there.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Petra then showed us the main floor where breakfast is served, the coffee machine is available all day, and a refrigerator that is stocked with soda, water and beer (free with your room). There is also a sitting area, were we spent an evening playing backgammon and other games that were available to use.
reviews.title: Ideal location and venue for the christmas markets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small hotel is in a residential area, and only a 10 minute walk to either the train station, a fresh food market, or a high-end shopping street. Petra, the owner, tries her very best to make her guests feel at home. I highly recommend staying a couple of days at the Max while exploring Dusseldorf. J.S., Toronto, Canada.
reviews.title: Max-imum Satisfaction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night here in June - not enough! We arrived in Dusseldorf on the train, hotel is only about 8-10 minutes walk away from the main station doors, flat and no need to get public transport.
reviews.title: Tremendous

reviews.text: One of the friendliest reception people we have come across, met us and showed us around. Hotel is very small - I like the word intimate though to describe it as it does it more justice, and great modern design. I loved the carpet on the wall, and the punching bag in the corridor!
reviews.title: Really a nice place

reviews.text: Hotel supplies free coffee and free water, free soft drinks and free beer , which you access from a fridge in the dining area at any time, what more can you ask for. Breakfast simple but satisfying, nice coffee.
reviews.title: Great value for money in Dusseldorf

reviews.text: Room like the hotel a very modern design, nice and quiet and plenty of space, view out the window...well um just make sure you close the curtains at night.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, can highly recommend a stay here

reviews.text: Small hotel a short walk from the train station. Rooms are simple and clean, with comfortable beds, free wifi, and a smallish but adequate bathroom with shower. There's a lot of stuff available in the corridor for you to use anytime : a laptop with printer, a microwave, cutlery,ironing board, etc. Great touch! And a coffee machine and mini-bar with water, coke and beer which are all free!
reviews.title: Simple and Elegant, with everything you need

reviews.text: The excellent Petra makes you feel right at home and is always ready to lend a hand with anything you may need. I was arriving late in the evening, and Petra sent me a mail in advance with instructions on how to get my key and how to call her if I had a problem. To make sure, she had left a note for me on the door as well!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: Breakfast is limited but adequate, and Petra will be happy to cook some eggs for you.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: The only issue was, you feel so much at home that you are over-careful about using stuff in your room and making sure you don't spill or dirty anything! And I didn't have the heart to tell her that I had a small problem with my shower area flooding due to a problem with the drainage.
reviews.title: Great find thanks to Trip Advisor and Lonely Planet!
